member.name: T:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Auditing.AuditDbContextBase`1
member.summary: AuditDbContextBase adds auditing capabilities to the DbContextBase. Auditing is enabled by default but may be disabled (AuditEnabled=false) if needed.

member.summary: Empty constructor is used for 'update-database' command-line command.

member.name: M:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Auditing.AuditDbContextBase`1.Reload(System.Object)
member.summary: Reloads the entity from the database overwriting any property values with values from the database. The entity will be in the Unchanged state after calling this method.

member.name: M:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Auditing.AuditDbContextBase`1.SaveChanges
member.summary: Saves all changes made in this context to the underlying database using the current windows user for auditing.
member.returns: The number of objects written to the underlying database.

member.returns: The number of objects written to the underlying database.

member.name: M:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Extensions.DbUpdateExceptionFormatter.IsValidSqlServerDatetime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Checks if is between 1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM and 12/31/9999 11:59:59 PM.
member.remarks: SQL Server defines two different datetime formats: The datetime datatype is capable of storing dates in the range 1753-01-01 to 9999-12-31. The datetime2 datatype was introduced in SQL Server 2008. The range of dates that it is capable of storing is 0001-01-01 to 9999-12-31.

member.name: M:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Extensions.MappingExtensions.Unique``1(System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.EntityTypeConfiguration{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}}[])
member.summary: Marks the properties in as unique. The index name is composed of all property names, e.g. UQ_PropertyA_PropertyB.
member.remarks: Note: If the unique property is of type string, you have to set the MaxLength.
member.param: The properties which are unique together.

member.name: M:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Extensions.MappingExtensions.Unique``1(System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.EntityTypeConfiguration{``0},System.String,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}}[])
member.summary: Marks the properties in as unique.
member.remarks: Note: If the unique property is of type string, you have to set the MaxLength.
member.param: The properties which are unique together.

member.name: M:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Extensions.MappingExtensions.IsUnique(System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.PrimitivePropertyConfiguration,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Marks the as unique.
member.remarks: Note: If the unique property is of type string, you have to set the MaxLength.
member.param: The name of the database index. Default is "UQ_Default" if not defined.
The column order of the index. Default is 0 if not defined.

member.name: M:EntityFramework.Toolkit.Extensions.MappingExtensions.HasIndex(System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.PrimitivePropertyConfiguration,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies an index to .
member.remarks: Note: If the indexed property is of type string, you have to set the MaxLength.
member.param: The name of the database index. Default is "IX_Default" if not defined.
Set this property to true to define a unique index. Set this property to false to define a non-unique index.
The column order of the index. Default is 0 if not defined.
